com.psddev.dari.db

Class AbstractDatabase<C>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.psddev.dari.db.AbstractDatabase<C>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Database, SettingsBackedObject
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MongoDatabase, SolrDatabase, SqlDatabase, WebDatabase

    public abstract class AbstractDatabase<C>
extends Object
implements Database
    Skeletal database implementation. A subclass must implement:
    • openConnection()
    • closeConnection(C)
    • Database.readLastUpdate(com.psddev.dari.db.Query<?>)
    • Database.readPartial(com.psddev.dari.db.Query<T>, long, int)
    • doWrites(C, boolean, java.util.List<com.psddev.dari.db.State>, java.util.List<com.psddev.dari.db.State>, java.util.List<com.psddev.dari.db.State>)

    If it supports read slaves, it should override:

    • doOpenReadConnection()

    It can override these to improve performance:

    • readAll(com.psddev.dari.db.Query<T>)
    • readAllGrouped(com.psddev.dari.db.Query<T>, java.lang.String...)
    • readCount(com.psddev.dari.db.Query<?>)
    • readFirst(com.psddev.dari.db.Query<T>)
    • readIterable(com.psddev.dari.db.Query<T>, int)
    • readPartialGrouped(com.psddev.dari.db.Query<T>, long, int, java.lang.String...)
    • doIndexes(C, boolean, java.util.List<com.psddev.dari.db.State>)
    • deleteByQuery(com.psddev.dari.db.Query<?>)

    If it supports transactional writes, it should override:

    • beginTransaction(C, boolean)
    • commitTransaction(C, boolean)
    • rollbackTransaction(C, boolean)
    • endTransaction(C, boolean)

      • openConnection

        public abstract C openConnection()
        Opens an implementation-specific connection to the underlying database. Once opened, the connection should be closed with closeConnection(C).
        Returns:
        Can't be null.

      • openReadConnection

        public final C openReadConnection()
        Opens an implementation-specific connection to the underlying database that can only be used for reading data. Once opened, the connection should be closed with closeConnection(C).
        Returns:
        Can't be null.

      • doOpenReadConnection

        protected C doOpenReadConnection()
        Called when this database needs to open an implementation-specific connection to the underlying database that can only be used for reading data. The default implementation calls openConnection().
        Returns:
        Can't be null.

      • beginWrites

        public final boolean beginWrites()
        Description copied from interface: Database
        Begins a series of writes. Note that for every call of this method, there must be a matching Database.endWrites() call, so a typical use would look like: 

         try {
     database.beginWrites();
     ...
     database.commitWrites(); // Or commitWritesEventually();
 } finally {
     database.endWrites();
 }
        Specified by:
        beginWrites in interface Database
        Returns:
        false if called within another nested transaction.

      • beginIsolatedWrites

        public final void beginIsolatedWrites()
        Specified by:
        beginIsolatedWrites in interface Database

      • commitWrites

        public final boolean commitWrites()
        Description copied from interface: Database
        Commits all pending writes. The data will either be saved, or discarded if there are any validation errors.
        Specified by:
        commitWrites in interface Database
        Returns:
        false if called within another nested transaction.

      • commitWritesEventually

        public final boolean commitWritesEventually()
        Description copied from interface: Database
        Commits all pending writes to be available for read eventually. If this method is used to write to the database, subsequent read to the saved data may not be available immediately.
        Specified by:
        commitWritesEventually in interface Database
        Returns:
        false if called within another nested transaction.

      • endWrites

        public final boolean endWrites()
        Description copied from interface: Database
        Ends the series of writes.
        Specified by:
        endWrites in interface Database
        Returns:
        false if called within another nested transaction.
